DataElement.preferredName: Disease Pathologic Stage Grouping Stratification Factor Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol based on the pathologic assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Pathologic Stage Grouping Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.:Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.

Concepts.definition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
